Row.Text: Force Mid-Turn New Save (Not recommended - may corrupt save game!)

DANGER! Emulate vanilla where a save of the current turn state could be made mid-turn by exploiting a bug in the overwrite file check. Normally a save is/was just a renamed copy of the most recent autosave. With this option enabled mid-turn state can be saved BUT Firaxis explicitly tried to prevent this, presumably because it can cause issues. This option is in NO WAY recommended and to use at own risk.
Embarking/disembarking in owned cities expends only 1 Movement
Embarking/disembarking in owned cities expends only 0.1 Movement
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]If you meet Theme requirements on this Building, gain:[ENDCOLOR] +{1_Num} {2_YieldIcon} {3_YieldName}
The City is instantly destroyed. In a One City Challenge, HUMAN players cannot keep captured cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Instant Yields gained this turn, and the prior {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;}[ENDCOLOR]
Instant Yields are gained in many ways, including Policies, Beliefs, and Buildings. A sum of Instant Yields earned from this turn, and the past 10 turns, will be listed here.

You declared war on your own vassal!
You have declared war on civilizations that you've resurrected!
You restored their civilization and then declared war on them!
They fear your warmongering will plunge the world into nuclear winter!
They cannot negotiate peace with you for another {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;} because of a deal they made with another player.
You are always at war with this player!
May not attack this player until current Peace Treaty with their ally (Defensive Pact or Master) expires.
May not declare war as a vassal (war is automatically declared when your Master declares war with this civilization).
You cannot declare war on your Master until you request independence or are liberated.
May not make peace with a vassal of another civilization (you must make peace with their master, {1_CivName}).
May not make peace as a vassal (peace is automatically made when your Master makes peace with this civilization).
Demand tribute from this civilization. This option carries a diplomatic penalty.
Request help from a player whom you've made a Declaration of Friendship with. This option does not carry a diplomatic penalty.

This value indicates how well your war is going. Ranges between [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-100[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]100[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Current war information:[ENDCOLOR]
[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT][ICON_STRENGTH] Military Power:[ENDCOLOR] They are very weak.
[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT][ICON_WAR] War Status:[ENDCOLOR] The war goes well.
[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT][ICON_WAR] War Status:[ENDCOLOR] Our victory is assured.
[ICON_BULLET] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT][ICON_RAZING] War Status:[ENDCOLOR] The war goes poorly.

If either player is attacked by another major civilization, the other player will immediately and automatically go to war with the aggressor. This agreement lasts {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
The following cities currently demand this Resource:
The leader's current valuation of this Deal. If the value here is negative or 'Impossible!', the leader refuses to trade one or more of the items in the Deal.
You cannot make deals during peacetime with this Civilization until the Sanction is lifted.
The leader's current valuation of this Peace Deal. If the value here is 'Impossible!', the leader refuses to trade one or more of the items in the Peace Deal.
Maximum value of items in Peace Deal. If the value to the left of this exceeds this number, the leader will refuse the deal.
Minimum value of items in Peace Deal. If this number exceeds the value to the left, the leader will refuse the deal.
Cannot add to non-surrendering party in Peace Deal.
At least one player lacks the required funds for this agreement.
Cannot trade one-time items (such as Gold) for items given over time (such as Resources).
A human teammate prevents this action.
We do not have a Capital City to receive their Embassy!
They do not have a Capital City to receive our Embassy!
Embassies cannot be established if either Civilization has denounced the other.
No other non-Vassal Civilizations are currently alive.
Defensive Pacts have been disabled by this game's options.
Vassals may not form Defensive Pacts.
Not allowed if deal contains Vassalage.
You may not make Defensive Pacts with more than {1_Num} civilizations.
They may not make Defensive Pacts with more than {1_Num} civilizations.
You are a vassal of {1_PlayerName:textkey} and cannot adopt vassals of your own.
They are a vassal of {1_PlayerName:textkey} and cannot adopt vassals of their own.
We must reach the Medieval Era to create vassals.
They must reach the Medieval Era to create vassals.
You are already a vassal of {1_CivName}!
They are already a vassal of {1_CivName}!
You cannot become their vassal for {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;} because it has been too soon since your vassalage ended.
They cannot become your vassal for {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;} because it has been too soon since their vassalage ended.
You cannot become their vassal because you have no cities or population!
They cannot become your vassal because they have no cities or population!
Not allowed if deal contains a Defensive Pact or Liberation.
They must be able to declare war on everyone you are at war with.
You must be able to declare war on everyone they are at war with.
We have no vassals to liberate!
They have no vassals to liberate!
We cannot ask our master to liberate their vassals!
They cannot ask their master to liberate vassals!
We recently vassalized someone and cannot perform this action for another {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
They recently vassalized someone and cannot perform this action for another {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
Can only include allied City-States in a Peace Deal.
A war agreement with another leader prevents this action.
A leader who has a Defensive Pact with the target also has a Declaration of Friendship or Defensive Pact with one of us.
A special game rule prevents this action.
Warscore must be at least {1_Num}. Current Warscore: {2_Num}.
Warscore against all civs on this team must be at least {1_Num}. Lowest Warscore: {2_Num}.
Cannot broker war against a vassal.
You cannot broker war against your master.
They cannot broker war against their master.
A Defensive Pact prevents this action.
Our master's Defensive Pact prevents this action.
Their master's Defensive Pact prevents this action.
A Declaration of Friendship prevents this action.
A Pledge of Protection prevents this action.
Clicking this button will [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]DENOUNCE[ENDCOLOR] the other player.

Choosing this option may alert the targeted player and their allies to your war preparations if the leader refuses to help and decides to warn the targeted player. This may have diplomatic repercussions![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Depending on the leader's response, a cooperative war could begin immediately, after 10 turns have passed, or as soon as one of you goes to war with the target.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cooperative wars are cancelled if you prematurely end your friendship with this leader (including through denouncements or war).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you befriend the target, form a Defensive Pact with them, or become unable to declare war on them, your agreement with this leader will also be cancelled.
A Declaration of Friendship is needed in order to discuss this.
There must be at least one civilization that you can both declare war on. NOTE: The target civilization must have at least one city.

This action cancels your current Declaration of Friendship, breaks your Defensive Pact (if you have one) and breaks any promises to go to war with others (unless already at war). This action will assuredly anger your friend, and may have severe global diplomatic repercussions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you denounce or declare war on this player within [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]10[ENDCOLOR] turns of cancelling your Declaration of Friendship, you will receive a diplomatic penalty for backstabbing them.
Please move your troops from our borders.

Ask the leader to remove their troops from your border. If the leader agrees to your request, [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]both of you[ENDCOLOR] will promise not to declare war on each other for 20 turns. If you break this promise, other leaders might view you as a backstabber![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If the leader rejects your request, they will declare war on you, so be careful!
This Promise will last for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] {1_Num: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;}. If you violate this Promise during this time, this player will feel betrayed!

Selecting this option creates a [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]mutual[ENDCOLOR] promise not to declare war on each other for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR] {1_Num: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;}. If you break this promise, other leaders might view you as a backstabber!
This Promise [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]does not expire[ENDCOLOR]. If you violate this Promise, other leaders might view you as a backstabber!

Selecting this insulting response may result in [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]war[ENDCOLOR]! If this insult does not result in war, the leader will be humbled, and their opinion of you will temporarily be reset to Neutral.

Choosing this option will alert {2_CivName:textkey} and their allies to the war preparations of {1_CivName:textkey}. This is a breach of diplomatic secrecy, which will anger {1_CivName:textkey} and please {2_CivName:textkey}!
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]We have a Defensive Pact with them![ENDCOLOR]
You aggressively attacked this City-State and cannot make peace for {1_Num} {1_Num: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}!

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]You aggressively attacked this City-State![ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]For the next [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{1_JerkRate}[ENDCOLOR] {1_JerkRate: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;}, the City-State will not give you any Quests, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence anchor will be reduced.[NEWLINE]If you [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]become Friends[ENDCOLOR] with this City-State during this time, these penalties will be removed early.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
They are currently [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]resilient[ENDCOLOR], because you are {1_FactorScore}% below the tribute threshold of [COLOR_CYAN]{2_Threshold}%[ENDCOLOR]:
They want you to find the city of {@1_CityName}.
Explore an unrevealed area of the world ([COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]% complete).
Construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] {@1_Building} {2_Num: plural 1?building; other?buildings;} in non-puppet cities in your empire.
They want you to conquer the city of {1_City}.
